medical_history.chief_complaint: Persistent umbilical wetness in the newborn.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The mother presented at 32 weeks of gestation with an ultrasound suggestive of a cystic lesion on the umbilical cord, initially measuring 3.6*1.9 cm, which increased in size at subsequent scans to 4.3*5.7 cm at 34 weeks and 5.5*6.0 cm at 35 weeks. At 36 weeks, there was decreased fetal monitoring leading to an emergency LSCS, after which the baby exhibited persistent umbilical wetness.
medical_history.social_history: The mother is a 26-year-old female, gravida 2 para 1 living 1, with no significant medical or obstetric history.
